example.description: Get a folder tree, that is, a tree representation of the folder "image-map".
Get folder trees of folders matching "image-map*". If there are several folders, the trees are wrapped in an "ftrees" element.

Get a folder tree in which every file is annotated with a @date attribute showing the file date. The whitespace after the equal sign is inserted in order to avoid string mangling caused by the command shell.
Get a folder tree in which every file is annotated with an @date attribute showing the file date and a @size attribute showing the file size. Use one parameter for each file property.
Get a folder tree in which every .dita file is annotate with a @ti attribute showing the title. In order to annotated selected files, use a file name selector preceding the property name.

Get a folder tree in which every every .dita file has a "hrefs" annotation, listing all file names referenced by href. Use two names separated by / in order to represent each value item in an element.
As the previous example, but suppress property items if the property value is the empty sequence. Use a ? after the property name in order to suppress empty property items.
